bibl.title: Letter from William E. Deeks to Henry Rose Carter, August 22, 1923

div1.p: Deeks writes that he may attempt community sterilization of malaria carriers by quinine in one of the United Fruit Company's tropical divisions. He seeks Carter's advice on this process.

div1.head: Letter from William E. Deeks to Henry Rose Carter, August 22, 1923
div1.opener:
Deeks Miscl
6000-5-21
N. Y. 24
UNITED FRUIT COMPANY
GENERAL OFFICES, 131 STATE STREET, BOSTON, MASS.
WILLIAM E. DEEKS, M. D.
GENERAL MANAGER
CABLE ADDRESS
UNIFRUITCO. NEW YORK
FILE NO.....................
MEDICAL DEPARTMENT
17 BATTERY PLACE, NEW YORK
August 22d, 1923
Dr. H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
The results of community sterilization of Malaria
carriers by quinine have impressed me so much that I am think-
ing of making an attempt to do the same thing on a large scale
in one of our divisions in the Tropics, and if the results are
justified will naturally extend it to the other divisions.

I believe we could handle our employees and their
families without difficulty, but we might have some trouble
with the small communities located near our people. However,
I am willing to make the attempt and go to the expense neces-
sary if you think it justifiable.

I would very much appreciate your valued opinion
as to its practical possibilities and any suggestions that you
care to make in regard to how it could best be carried out,
organization, dosage, etc.
Thanking you in anticipation of an early reply,
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, W E Deeks
General Manager WED/KD
